item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m a PhD Candidate with the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics in Monash Univerisity. I’m working with Catherine Forbes and Anastasios Panagiotelis to develop fast algorithms to update forecasts as more data is observed. For more details, see my research page. I’m also teaching Statistical Methods for Insurance, and Financial Econometrics at Monash, and I’ll add more details for these subjects throughout the next two semesters as the classes progress.

item.title: Bayesian Statistics
item.description: What is this all about? Imagine playing a game where your opponent has a rigged dice, before the game starts you probably think that every side is equally likely to be rolled, but after they roll several sixes in a row you might begin to think that somethingâ€™s wrong. Bayesian statistics is a tool that lets us express a change in belief as more data (or dice rolls) are observed using probability, the mathematical language of uncertainty.
